alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 5:21AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Breezy on Interior Summits today into Wednesday... ...Cooler temperatures through Friday morning... Winds will increase on the summits today to 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 35 mph, then diminish Wednesday night. Interior highway summits, including Finger Mountain and Atigun Pass on the Dalton Highway, Ptarmigan Pass on the Elliott Highway, and 12 mile and Eagle summits on the Steese Highway can expect blowing snow to reduce visibility locally, while drifting snow may impact travel as drifts form on the roads. Wind Chill on the summits near 40 below at times through Wednesday morning. Valleys across the Interior will have low temperatures of 15 to 30 below through Friday, while hills will have lows of 5 to 15 below. Highs of zero to 10 above expected through Friday. Temperatures warming this weekend. Travelers over Summits of the Steese, Elliott and Dalton Highways through Wednesday should be prepared for large snow drifts and very cold wind chills. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
